models module

class models.Product(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a product available for purchase in the system.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the product

  • name (str) – Name of the product

  • category (str) – Category of the product

  • price (float) – Price of the product

  • description (str) – Description of the product, nullable

  • stock (int) – Quantity of the product available in stock

category
description

query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

stock
class models.PurchaseHistory(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Tracks purchase history of users for products.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the purchase record

  • customer_id (int) – Foreign key to the user who made the purchase

  • product_id (int) – Foreign key to the product that was purchased

  • purchase_time (datetime) – Timestamp when the purchase was made, defaults to the current time

customer_id
id
product_id
purchase_time
query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

class models.Review(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a review written by a user for a product.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the review

  • product_id (int) – Foreign key to the product being reviewed

  • customer_id (int) – Foreign key to the user who wrote the review

  • rating (int) – Numerical rating given to the product

  • comment (str) – Optional text comment for the review

  • flagged (bool) – Boolean indicating whether the review has been flagged for moderation, defaults to False

comment
customer_id
flagged

query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

rating
class models.User(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a user in the system with various attributes, including a unique username and a role determining their permissions.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the user

  • username (str) – Unique username for the user

  • password (str) – Hashed password for the user

  • full_name (str) – Full name of the user

  • age (int) – Age of the user

  • address (str) – Residential address of the user

  • gender (str) – Gender of the user

  • marital_status (str) – Marital status of the user

  • wallet (float) – Current balance in the user’s wallet, defaults to 0.0

  • role (str) – Role of the user in the system (e.g., Admin, Customer)

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning
